Wall Street economists expected a 0.2 percent drop in July construction spending.
Construction spending in 1992 dollars, which discounts the effects of inflation:
Annual Rates, Billions of U.S. Dollars --

The 1.4 percent drop in total construction spending during July was the largest monthly decline since a 2.6 percent fall in five months since a 2.6 percent decrease in February. The $554.7 billion annual rate of spending in July also was the lowest since February when it was at a rate of $544.6 billion.
Spending on new housing units dropped 1.6 percent in July to a $174.7 billion rate, the biggest monthly drop since a 2.4 percent decline in May 1995.
